comment: This is generated by ESQL's AbstractFunctionTestCase. Do not edit it. See ../README.md for how to regenerate it.
name: st_geohex
description:
Calculates the `geohex`, the H3 cell-id, of the supplied geo_point at the specified precision.
The result is long encoded. Use TO_STRING to convert the result to a string,
TO_LONG to convert it to a `long`, or TO_GEOSHAPE to calculate
the `geo_shape` bounding geometry.

These functions are related to the `geo_grid` query
and the `geohex_grid` aggregation.

params.name: geometry
params.description: Expression of type `geo_point`. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: precision
params.description: Expression of type `integer`. If `null`, the function returns `null`. Valid values are between [0 and 15](https://h3geo.org/docs/core-library/restable/).

params.name: geometry
params.description: Expression of type `geo_point`. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: precision
params.description: Expression of type `integer`. If `null`, the function returns `null`. Valid values are between [0 and 15](https://h3geo.org/docs/core-library/restable/).

params.name: bounds
params.description: Optional bounds to filter the grid tiles, a `geo_shape` of type `BBOX`. Use [`ST_ENVELOPE`](#esql-st_envelope) if the `geo_shape` is of any other type.

examples:
FROM airports
| EVAL geohex = ST_GEOHEX(location, 1)
| STATS
    count = COUNT(geohex),
    centroid = ST_CENTROID_AGG(location)
      BY geohex
| WHERE count >= 10
| EVAL geohexString = TO_STRING(geohex)
| KEEP count, centroid, geohexString
| SORT count DESC, geohexString ASC
